meanings.definition: Not cynical; having or showing a lack of distrust or skepticism.
meanings.sent1: She had an uncynical belief in the goodness of people.
meanings.sent2: His uncynical nature made him see the best in everyone.
meanings.sent3: It was refreshing to meet someone so uncynical in today's world.
meanings.sent4: Her uncynical view of the world was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The child's uncynical innocence was a joy to behold.

meanings.definition: Not sarcastic or mocking in a negative way.
meanings.sent1: His uncynical jokes always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated his uncynical sense of humor that never hurt anyone's feelings.
meanings.sent3: The uncynical tone of his voice made it clear he was being genuine.
meanings.sent4: Her uncynical remarks were like a breath of fresh air in a room full of sarcasm.
meanings.sent5: The uncynical way he teased his friends showed his kind-hearted nature.
